silhouette.shapes
Class AbstractSilShape

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--silhouette.constraints.constrainedObject
        |
        +--silhouette.shapes.AbstractSilShape
All Implemented Interfaces:
SilShape
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoxShape, LineShape
public abstract class AbstractSilShape
extends constrainedObject
implements SilShape

The abstract ancestor for all Silhouette shapes. All silhouette shapes support the following properties:

  1. visible: whether or not the shape is visible.
  2. parent: the composite object to which the shape belongs
  3. lineColor: the color used to draw the object's boundary
  4. fillColor: the color used to fill the object
  5. Filled: whether the fillColor is used to fill the object or whether the object is drawn as a transparent object

The user can add additional properties using the setValue method and retrieve these properties using the getValue method. Additional properties are named using strings and their values are Java Objects.

find

public SilShape find(double x,
                     double y)
Locates the Shape at the given x, y position.
Returns:
A Shape if found, null otherwise. For leaf objects, we already know that the object contains the given (x,y) point so just return the object. This is the default case.

findShapes

public void findShapes(int x,
                       int y,
                       java.util.Stack foundShapes)
find all the shapes in the composite object hierarchy that contain the given (x,y) point. This default version of findShapes simply adds the shape to the stack of shapes containing the point. An object's findShapes method will be called only if it has already been ascertained that the object contains the point.
Specified by:
findShapes in interface SilShape
